comments.author: Edwardard
comments.body: Wow nice catch OP, btw Im shocked to see your first post and straight away an alt-hunting thread. How did you manage to connect these accounts ? I am eager to know since those account's posts are from 2021 and you just joined the forum recently. You must have done a long research lol.Quoting your image for ease of visibility!Quote from: Account Banned on February 27, 2023, 01:38:18 AM

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.created_time: February 27, 2023, 04:18:30 AMLast edit: June 07, 2023, 06:06:19 PM by yahoo62278
comments.body: Quote from: Edwardard on February 27, 2023, 04:09:15 AMWow nice catch OP, btw Im shocked to see your first post and straight away an alt-hunting thread. How did you manage to connect these accounts ? I am eager to know since those account's posts are from 2021 and you just joined the forum recently. You must have done a long research lol.Quoting your image for ease of visibility!Quote from: Account Banned on February 27, 2023, 01:38:18 AMMaybe he owns those accounts and made another to come in and try to make a quick name for himself??? Hard to say.I want to go on record and say that if the bounty participants you people want to connect are all newbie accounts and the bounty rules don't seem to mind newbies joining, then don't waste time reporting them. The newbie could care less if tagged in most cases because the manager isn't even going to look at their trust most likely. IMO would be better to report it to the manager, then if they don't take action(assuming the proof is solid) then we might consider starting to tag the manager? Just an idea.

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on February 27, 2023, 04:18:30 AMQuote from: Edwardard on February 27, 2023, 04:09:15 AMWow nice catch OP, btw Im shocked to see your first post and straight away an alt-hunting thread. How did you manage to connect these accounts ? I am eager to know since those account's posts are from 2021 and you just joined the forum recently. You must have done a long research lol.Quoting your image for ease of visibility!Quote from: Account Banned on February 27, 2023, 01:38:18 AMMaybe he owns those accounts and made another to come in and try to make a quick name for himself??? Hard to say.I want to go on record and say that if the bounty participants you people want to connect are all newbie accounts and the bounty rules don't seem to mind newbies joining, then don't waste time reporting them. The newbie could care less if tagged in most cases because the manager isn't even going to look at their trust most likely. IMO would be better to report it to the manager, then if they don't take action(assuming the proof is solid) then we might consider starting to tag the manager? Just an idea.That is highly unlikely. How does someone make a name for themselves in their first post connecting some multiple accounts? Better yet, why would anyone expose three of their accounts just to make a name for a brand new one? I feel like maybe this is personal. Or, a member who is not looking to use their main account to expose the accounts. I very highly doubt it is the same user exposing his own accounts.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: I think only both @Bas120 and @Network40 are a valid connected accounts, although @Momena1795 might be their alt, but I just want to prevent from possible drama where this user will say he's accidentally copied someone POA.However there's no prove if they're cheating in bounties, I've dig both of those accounts to see if they've joined a same campaign.Quote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5350403.msg57697806#msg57697806#PROOF OF REGISTRATIONForum Username: Network 40Forum Profile Link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3364565Telegram Username: @Network4000Participated Campaigns: articleBSC Wallet Address: 0x9faA38f39573784AB391F88c4180Ec1AB91537aeQuote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5350403.msg57676773#msg57676773#pruf of RegistrationFrom username: Bas120From Profile Link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3191237Telegram username: @SompakhanomParticipated Campaigns: ArticleBEP-20 wallet address: 0xb5724110BcE7Eee3dF8512AEFFC8C143D20ddFf7Quote from: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5350403.07. Using multiple accounts, cheating and spamming are not allowed. You will be disqualified from the bounty program immediately and all your accounts will bebanned permanently.With this proof it's already clear if both @Bas120 and @Network40 are cheating in the same campaign, they've broke the campaign rule. I will leave negative feedback to both accounts, you could give me more proof about @@Momena1795 connected with those accounts.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: If such account are being found they should immediately report all of them to the bounty manager, in a case where bounty manager refused to take any action concerning the alt account caught cheating then you should know he already knew about the incident. There information should get removed instantly from the spreadsheet, most times participants are too lazy to make a bounty report which happens to turn out getting another participants report to repost them on the thread.All connected account can be tag.
